data.title: Princeton Public Schools
data.meta_description: Princeton School District 477 is a Pre-K through grade 12 public school district in Minnesota.
data.text:
All schools will start 15 minutes earlier next year.

Read More about New School Start Times for 2024-2025

FREE Summer Meals Program Starts June 10. All children ages 1-18 can eat for FREE at Princeton Primary School.

Read More about Summer Meals Program 2024

Start your Application for Educational Benefits today through Family Access.

Read More about 24-25 Application for Education Benefits

We are proud to announce that Cayden Granger, Class of 2025, has earned the honor of Scholar of Distinction.

Read More about PHS Student Named Scholar of Distinction

Summer hours are effective June 3 through August 9, and most schools are open by appointment only.

Read More about Summer 2024 Office Hours

Hannah Doty, a senior in the Human Services Career Academy, explores her passion for working with children.

Read More about Exploring Passions Through High School Career Academies

Summer EBT is a new food support program provided by the USDA that provides families $120 for eligible school-aged children to buy groceries when school is out for the summer.

Read More about Summer EBT Program

Palmer Bus re-routing all buses this summer, so any family needing busing has to submit through Family Access by August 1.

Read More about Bus Forms Due August 1

Our high school Career Academies are helping students pursue their passions, gain valuable job skills, and earn college credits. High school senior Madelynn Jo Behning is navigating the Engineering, Manufacturing and Technology Career Academy at PHS. She offers this advice to high school students: â€œDo the Career Academy; you won't regret it. Even if you're unsure of your career path, take classes to discover what you like and don't like. It's all about real-world experience."

Read More about Exploring Engineering Through Princeton High School Career Academies
